thread.title: Marlins Man donates $10K to families of Kansas City fallen firef
thread.title_full: Marlins Man donates $10K to families of Kansas City fallen firef - KCTV5

author: Chris Oberholtz, Multimedia Producer
title: Marlins Man donates $10K to families of Kansas City fallen firef
text:
KANSAS CITY, MO (KCTV) - Royals fans have seen him sitting behind home plate at nearly every pivotal playoff game the past few seasons, but now the Marlins Man is helping the families of two Kansas City fallen firefighters.
The International Association of Fire Fighters said that Laurence Leavy donated $10,000 to the families of Larry Leggio and John Mesh, who died Monday when a building collapsed on them in the northeast part of the city.
Leggio, 43, a 17-year veteran and fire apparatus operator, leaves a wife and mother. Mesh, 39, is survived by a wife and four daughters.
The Marlin Man has donated $10K to the families of FFs Leggio and Mesh Leavy, a 59-year-old Miami lawyer, has also been sporting a specially designed Royals hat made as a tribute to Leggio and Mesh instead of his Marlins visor.
Last season, Leavy put his bright orange Marlins jersey and visor on eBay to raise more than $5,000 for the Make-A-Wish Foundation.
